abstract: Trial of Baltimore Police Officer William G Porter, one of six officers charged with murder of black man  Freddie Gray while in custody, begins; activists are braced for verdict in racially-charged case where defendant, judge and prosecutor are all black; experts assert acquittal could lead to more unrest and make convicting other officers difficult.
lead_paragraph: Some see the case against Officer William G. Porter, one of the six officers charged in Mr. Gray’s death, as a test of the criminal justice system.

headline.main: First Trial in Freddie Gray Death Is Set to Start in Baltimore
headline.print_headline: The First Trial for 6 Officers in Baltimore Is Set to Start

snippet: Some see the case against Officer William G. Porter, one of the six officers charged in Mr. Gray’s death, as a test of the criminal justice system.
